problem_text:
Let G be a nilpotent group in which every coset x[G, G] for x ̸∈[G, G] coincides with the conjugacy class xG. Is there a bound for the nilpotency class of G?
If G is finite, then its class is at most 3 (R. Dark, C. Scoppola, J. Algebra, 181, no. 3 (1996), 787–802).
S. H. Ghate, A. S. Muktibodh
